label: 権律師
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A Buddhist official, being one of the Buddhist Hierarchy (Sōgō), who holds one of the provisional posts (gon-kan). Those Buddhist priests who held this post and are mentioned in this book are as follows, being listed in the order of their appearance in the text: Shōhō, Mukū, and Ryōgen [Jikei-Daishi]. [僧綱、権官、聖宝、無空、良源、慈恵大師 (also read Jie Daishi)]
